visualization_prompt: Generate a pie chart showing proportional atmospheric gas composition using a donut-style layout with interactive data labels and legend synchronization
visualization_explanation: The dataset represents univariate compositional data with five nominal categories (atmospheric gases) and their corresponding percentage values. While based on real-world atmospheric science measurements, the visualization extends standard N₂-O₂-Ar breakdown with additional trace gas detail for educational completeness. Synthetic expansion maintains domain validity through EPA atmospheric science references and precision-appropriate rounding. The donut chart variant was selected to maximize data-ink ratio per Tufte's principles while maintaining proportional accuracy. Cairo's perceptual topology principles are applied through: 1) Legend-textured color coding, 2) White-outlined descending value sorting, and 3) High-contrast (60% luminance variation) sequential blue hues. Data follows strict compositional constraints (∑=100%) with μ=20.0, σ=30.8 reflecting natural atmospheric distribution skew. Interactive elements (tooltip details, slice toggling) maintain Cairo's principle of proportional ink while enabling user-driven data exploration.
